page.title: 07 St Peters Church Gt Haseley
page.content: St Peters Church is the largest in the diocese apart from Dorchester Abbey.The tower is an important and predominent feature.It contains a bell-tower and a clock facing the village.It is said that the tower resembles a castle and that in olden times was a form of defence for the villagers. The church has a pipe organ that was installed last year (1984).The organ was purchased second hand and it came from a redundant chapel in Scotland. Years ago the church had an orchestra in the manner of village churches.The last instrument was stolen from the church recently.Similarly lead was removed from the roof by thieves,now replaced with copper sheet. Holy Communion is celebrated each Sunday. by Shane Smith.
